title: Great overview of the Gothic Quarter
text: Our guide, Pol, was very knowledgeable about this area of the city was able to enthral all of us with his stories and history. The Gothic Quarter was hidden away close to the hotel I was staying at (1898) -- I would not have found it had it not been for this tour. The next day I was able to wander through this sectionsand really got to appreciate the history. I wish I would have had more time in Barcelona as I would have taken more tours and after the good experience with Pol -- I would have used We Barcelona, as I'm sure that the guides would have been of this calibre -- fluent in English and filled with knowledge.

title: What fun!
text: Just walking through this district gives you the feel of Greece and the people It was so friendly and seemed to have anything that a tourist would be looking for!

title: Breathtaking!
text: I was very glad to have a guide for this location as I would not have really understood the meaning of each building and what it represented.

title: Excellent location -- quiet rooms.
text: Only 1/2 block from Les Rambles -- 1 block from the hop on hop off bus, 1 blood from the market -- close to the Gothic Quarter. Probably one of the friendliest hotels I have stayed in -- I will definitely stay here the next time I'm in Barcelona.

title: Great location -- quiet location. What more can you ask?
text: Totally within walking disgrace from the Plaka, Accopolis, Hop on Hop off tours -- and amazing restaurants. The staff could not have been more helpful -- they all understood english and answered all questions without hesitation. Next time I don't know if I would take the included breakfast -- there are so many other great places to eat close to the hotel -- and I would have loved to try a traditional Greek breakfast. The breakfast that was served was good -- just like I ate at home.

title: Friday Night Dinner
text: This little gem is open on Friday night for dinner from 6pm - 9pm. The menu is set with a choice of 2 items for the entree. The night we were there Salmon and Steak were served. I had the salmon and it could not have been better! The Creme Brûlée for desert was amazing. This is a great place to take out of town guests.

title: Wish it was truly a restaurant
text: Good to see this diner -- however, thought that we would be able to sit down and have something to eat. It is just a store front for a TV set.

title: Surprisingly Amazing!
text: I did not expect to find a hotel like this in High River. The room was spacious and the view of the mountains was fantastic. My hotel room had a microwave and fridge -- also a coffee maker. Wendy, the manager, went out of her way to assure that everything was perfect and gave us a run down of what to do and where to go. Her assistant, Mercedes, was just as helpful. Breakfast was better than expected.

title: 6 Table Restaurant that has excellent food and marvellous service!
text: We just happened to be driving by this quaint little restaurant yesterday and decided to stop in -- we were pleasantly surprised by the waiter (who is also the owner -- his wife is the chef). There are only 6 tables and when they are filled there is a sign posted outside to let others know they are full. The menu is robust including a lot of gluten free suggestions. I was delighted and definitely will be back!

title: Looking for Great Homemade?
text: Every time I'm at the Heartland Cafe I am amazed at the quality of the home made soup! It is usually so plentiful it is all I need -- however, when I do choose anything else from the menu, I'm never disappointed. It is so spacious -- you aren't sitting close enough to anyone to hear their conversation. The ambiance is amazing ..... it is well worth a trip to Okotoks!

title: Great Food, Friendly Service, Marvellous Ambience
text: Cute train car that serves delicious home made food -- especially desserts! I had a bowl of soup and a wrap -- both were really tasty. This is a small restaurant that we in High River need to remember -- it is a great place for lunch.

title: Lovely Hotel with a great location
text: We spent a couple of nights before our Windstar cruise and was very pleased with the location of the hotel. The room was spacious -- however, as it was on the front of the hotel it was fairly noisy as it is on quite a busy street.

title: Basic Hotel Room
text: Nothing special about the room -- and as the hotel is on a main drag it is quiet noisy -- with the sounds of the subway constantly vibrating through the hotel. The staff are remarkable -- and the location is great.

title: Match the map to your travel needs -- and hop on!
text: There are several routes that you can take -- so look at the map and choose where you want to go -- it's easy after that!
place: City Sightseeing Lisbon Hop On -Hop Off

title: Phenomenal Palace
text: This is an experience beyond words -- the quality of the palace is second to none -- with the tour though it to be very thorough and answers questions as to who lived there -- and exactly their relationships to one another. The views from here are magnificent.
place: Park and National Palace of Pena

title: Quaint City -- very touristy!
text: I loved walking the streets of Sintra -- even though it is definitely a tourist town -- it offers a lot of good choices of great things to take home to those the didn't make the trip with you!

title: Cascais is just a great town to visit
text: This town offers history and great shopping -- it was such fun to walk around and do a little shopping.

title: Experience Budapest with a Local!
text: I had a day and a half in Budapest -- and wanted to see all that I could. This was fabulous -- we combined walking with driving -- This gave me the ability to see and experience this amazing city. Orsolya, the tour guide, knows the area so well -- she gave an excellent commentary about everything -- which allowed me to understand what made up this very diverse city. She explained the history of communism to the life as they live it today. I could not have asked for more!

title: Great Hotel Close to the Heart of the City
text: Very comfortable room with all the amenities. There is no restaurant on premises -- but they do serve a great buffet for breakfast and there are a lot of eating places within walking distance. Everyone in the hotel spoke fluent English.

title: A "Must See" if you are in Budapest on a Sunday
text: I have never seen such a great marketplace -- filled with unique original things from edible items to quirky artistic ones! The place that it is held is totally Bohemian and filled with amazing smells and people. I was waiting for everyone to break out in song! It had an energy that I've never experienced before and would like to again. They had a soup made from fresh vegetables -- available just with the vegetables or with some meat added. Combined with a fresh slice of bread and the ambience of the marketplace made this an attraction that was one of the best on my trip through Europe.

title: Great English -- Great Knowledge of Paris
text: I had already been to the "Tourist Attractions" -- Eiffel Tower etc. This was a great way to discover the off of the beaten path places to see in Paris. The driver's english was impeccable and she knew where to take me to show me another side of Paris that I would have never seen on a regular tour. Riding in this cute little vehicle was so much fun!

title: Want to laugh until your Tummy hurts?
text: From the time this show started until it ended we were all laughing. It showed exactly what Parisians were like -- without being hurtful in any way. It was just a fun time in a glorious city.
place: How to become Parisian in one hour?

title: More than met expectations
text: When we checked into the hotel we were assigned a room that only had one bed -- which, when we booked 6 months ago, we requested 2 beds. One bed was unacceptable -- so for the first night they supplied us with a roll-away -- the next day we were moved to a suite with 2 beds and a separate sitting room. As we were there for 7 nights -- the suite was an absolute delight to have! This was just a taste of the level of service that this hotel provides.

title: Take the guided tour!
text: The opera house is a national treasure -- make sure that you take the guided tour to find out all of the details of this amazing structure.

title: Over 1,000 stone steps
text: I took an all inclusive day tour from Paris -- we got there by lunch time and the lunch was quite awful (however, there are great restaurants there -- so don't get anything with lunch included). I was not prepared for the number of steps there are -- they are uneven and no handrail. I was with a guide that went far too quickly -- I and about 1/2 of the tour could not keep up. I wish I would have gotten a self guided tour -- I could have gone at my own pace.

title: Breathtaking!
text:
I took a guided tour from Paris .... taking the train out to Versailles -- I met the guide at a meeting point -- then he had the tickets for the train and the Palace -- which was great as there was a long line up .... and we just passed them by and went in another entrance.

We went on a Friday -- which is magical -- as all of the fountains were working (I didn't know ... but the fountains only work at certain times on certain days) They were a highlight of the tour.

The Palace is great -- and has a lot of history. Unfortunately I was a little "placed' out by the time I got here ... but the grounds, the music that was played throughout the grounds, and the whole story of the palace really was worth the tour!

title: Gals trip to the Spa!
text: A good friend and I decided to treat ourselves to a couple of days of pampering. Unfortunately on the second day my friend became violently ill with a middle ear issue. The staff at the Spa and the Hotel could not have been better -- they were so very concerned and even called home after we left to insure she was feeling better. I proceeded to enjoy the offerings of this amazing Spa and hotel as she slept! The pools and the view were equally amazing. The 4 treatments I received were very good -- can't say that they were the best I've ever received but they were very good. Next time I'm going to try some of the different treatments that they offer.

title: Very Average Casino
text: I spent a few hours one night ... I spent most of my time wandering around ... there didn't seem to be a lot of winners -- just a lot of people losing there money.

title: Amazing Food, Service and Scenery
text: I have always heard about this restaurant, but never had gone. Did I ever miss out! The steak I ordered truly did melt in my mouth, the salad and the vegetables were fresh and tasty. I didn't have dessert but those at the table that did devoured them -- and asked for the recipes. Everything is made fresh daily -- and this is truly family run! The whole family made sure that we were looked after ..... It is truly an experience ... and one that I will have again!

title: Just a simple Chicken Restaurant
text: I have eaten in, and taken out -- and loved the chicken both times. The pieces seemed larger than most chicken restaurants -- and the fries are great (home made). I heard that the source all of their chicken locally -- and if that is so -- I truly appreciate it!

title: Very Disappointing
text: I have always heard about this tiny takeout hamburger joint in High River -- so was expecting something more than a small patty and some cheese on a store bought bun when I ordered my cheeseburger. Nothing more than the cheese or the meat.... and the patty didn't even fill the bun -- which was small. No lettuce, no onion, no type of sauce. My banana shake was very thin .... and I was expecting a great tasting thick shake. This certainly isn't a "Peters" -- or a Dairy Queen for that matter.

title: Friendly Decadence
text: I arrived very early as my cruise on the Aranui was over at 8am ..... I was prepared to have to wait in the lobby -- but after they served me a cool drink -- my room was ready! I had just a standard room -- it was spacious and filled with flowers! I was impresses with everything about this resort -- especially the friendliness of all of the staff (even though I didn't speak a word of French -- that didn't matter to them!)

title: The Stars have never shone this brightly
text: I went on the night tour of the observatory. It was a cloudless sky and there was a blanket of stars like I've never seen before. We all were given the ability to look through a variety of telescopes that were looking at stars I didn't even know about -- like the Jewel box. It was a breathtaking experience. I thought that I was going to be chilly -- up on the mountain -- at night, however, they had jackets for us to wear and offered us hot chocolate to drink. It was a night that I shall always remember.

title: The Brilliance of the Stars take your Breath away
text: You are able to see stars that you have never seen before. The leaders of the tour are well versed and knowledgable. It was amazing to see the milky way stretched across the sky...... The guides pointed out star formations, planets, solar systems and even the space station.

title: Hiro is a Great Ambassador for Moorea!
text: Standing at the Ferry in Tahiti -- suitcase in one hand, ticket in another -- and surrounded by people all moving in different directions, I truly didn't know what to do. Hiro noticed my confusion -- explained what I needed to do -- where I needed to drop off my luggage and helped me onto the boat. His most informative booklet allowed me to understand the island -- and used it to find great dining places and found the perfect tour. I wish there was a Hiro to meet me at every place I traveled to lend a helping hand.

title: Great fruit, jams and honey!
text: I got to sample so many great tasting jams .... and the pineapple was so sweet! I bought far too much! However, we are all enjoying this taste of the South Pacific as we sit at home and remember the trip!

title: Amazing Bar-B-Que
text: It was my last night in Moorea -- and I didn't feel like fine dining, but wanted good food. I had spotted Manula earlier in the day so thought it was worth a try. Oh my gosh -- probably one of the best meals I had on the island! The pork ribs were succulent and came with a variety of sauces. It was a marvellous end to a spectacular trip!

title: Mario has great knowledge of the people and the island -- in all languages!`
text: Mario is fluent in English, French, Spanish and Italian (and perhaps a few others!) -- he seamlessly changes from one language to another -- so no one is left out. He has a great sense of humour and is able to put everyone in his tour at ease and has them chatting to one another right away. He was able to explain about the island, the culture and the people -- and answered everyones questions in such a humour way that we seemed to be laughing all of the time. Thank you Mario -- you are a delight!

title: Down Home Food and Friendly Staff
text: If you are looking for a meal like your Mom used to make you for lunch -- this is the place to go. They have great soup complete with home made bread. There are always specials -- and I've never had one I didn't enjoy. Their desserts are home made and fresh each day. This really is a 'go to' place for me when I'm in High River and it is lunch time. All of their staff try to make you feel at home -- and never rushed.

title: Baked Spaghetti -- Amazing
text: It is extremely rare to find baked spaghetti on a menu -- so I was happy to see it -- and then more delighted when it was served with the cheese bubbling on top -- the meat sauce was really flavourful -- and the portion was more than I could eat (which means I could have it for lunch the next day). The others with me had pizza and they said it, too, was way better than they had expected for a small town pizza place. We will definitely be coming here again (and again......)

title: Great Food and wonderful people
text: I arrived in San Francisco a day before the rest of my group. I was advised by the hotel to go to Fior D'Italia. I sat at the bar and got to meet local people (and their dogs). Happy hour food was at 1/2 price....and it was great. After my group arrived we went to the restaurant 2 more times ... .the food was always amazing. I tried something different each time. Next time I'm in the Bay Area, I will definitely eat here.

title: The best Mojito on the wharf
text: Top this off with a bowl of clam chowder ......and the meal is complete. I was so impressed that I came back a couple of times

title: Total Pampering
text: 8 hours in the spa .... And then a glass of wine in the library bar. There are no words to explain how decadent this place is ....and at such an reasonable price. We were there way before check in time .....they had our spa stuff ready for us .....and we were good to go. The pool on top of the hotel gives you a view of Zurich like none other.

title: Peaceful
text: You don't even have to know how to meditate! I just perched myself on a rock and let the feeling of calmness wash over me.

title: Coffee and a Paper -- anything better?
text: Oh yes -- that it is in Ojai (which is a gift in itself) Delicious coffee... with scrumptious sweets to enjoy with it. Sitting outside watching the world of Ojai unfold.... amazing.

title: A day in Wellington with Jennifer makes a person want more.....
text: She blew into the Hotel Lobby with a smile that warmed the chilly day -- her knowledge of the city that she so loves began with the paintings hanging in the main stairway of the Hotel. As we walked through the city Jennifer was able to weave the history, politics, personalities, and landscapes into the story of Wellington.

title: So much under one roof!
text: Great museum -- well laid out and easy to navigate.
place: Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa

title: Amazing
text: What a great way to travel up the hill. And the tea house at the top was a nice treat.

title: Interesting
text: Just off the beaten path was this little hint of something different.
